body.p: Leukocytes often act in the interstitial fluid between tissues, but at some point that fluid is drained from the tissues and collected. When this happens we refer to the fluid as __________________ , and it is _______________________.

input.choice: bad humor, destroyed by the liver
plasma, eliminated from the body
cell juice, recycled in the blood
lymph, returned to the blood supply via lymph vessels

feedback.p: Incorrect. Humor was term used by the ancient Greeks.
Incorrect. Plasma is the liquid portion of the blood.
Incorrect , cell juice is not at term used in anatomy and physiology
Correct. Lymph is returned to the blookd supply via lymph vessels.

body.p: Which if the following examples is NOT an example of immunity?

input.choice: Newborn receives antibodies from the mother via breast milk.
A person vaccinated against the Hepatitis B virus does not get infected by it.
A person bit by a rattlesnake survives by receiving an anti-venom antiserum.
A person infected with HIV loses T helper cells.
All the above are examples of immunity.

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is an example of passive immunity.
Incorrect. This is an example of active immunity.
Incorrect. This is an example of passive immunity.
Correct. This is an example of an immune deficiency.
Incorrect. Losing T cells as part of HIV infection is not an example of immunity, but immune deficiency.

body.p: What is the difference between interstitial fluid and lymph?

input.choice: Interstitial fluid contains white blood cells while lymph does not.
Interstitial fluid is present in the space between cells, while lymph circulates in the lymphatic vessels.
Fluids move bidirectionally between capillaries and interstitial fluid, but only in one direction from interstitial fluid to lymph.
A and B
B and C

feedback.p: Incorrect. Both fluids contain white blood cells.
Partially correct. Check for other correct choices.
Partially correct. fluids move between capillaries and interstitial fluid depending on the net pressure between the two, while excess fluid moves into the lymphatic vessels.
Partially Correct. Lymph circulates in the lymphatic vessels, but it contains white blood cells as well.
Correct. Lymph circulates in the blood vessels, and it consists of the excess fluid coming from the interstitial fluid.

input.choice: as permeable as blood capillaries
completely impermeable
less permeable than blood capillaries
more permeable than blood capillaries

feedback.p: Incorrect. Due to the overlap of endothelial cells, lymphatic capillaries are more permeable than blood capillaries.
Incorrect. Due to the overlap of endothelial cells, lymphatic capillaries are more permeable than blood capillaries.
Incorrect. Due to the overlap of endothelial cells, lymphatic capillaries are more permeable than blood capillaries.
Correct. Due to the overlap of endothelial cells, lymphatic capillaries are more permeable than blood capillaries.

body.p: When comparing the circulation of blood and lymph, it is important to remember that blood___________and lymph ________________. .

input.choice: is a “closed” system and recirculates; is returned to the tissues it came from
contains mostly cells and fluids with no proteins; contains mostly proteins and fats
composition is influenced by many organ systems; is collected from the tissues without being modified
return to the heart is aided by the muscular pump; is moved by the pumping action of the heart

feedback.p: Incorrect. lymph is collected and returned to the venous blood system.
Incorrect blood contains many proteins, and lymph contains cells.
Correct. Water and electrolyte content in the blood are influenced by many other organ systems. Lymph is not altered after it is collected.
Incorrect. While venous return of blood is aided by the muscular pump, the lymph does not move because of the pumping action of the heart.

body.p: Select the incorrect match between cause and resulting immune disorder.

input.choice: exaggerated immune response to an otherwise harmless antigen / hay fever
immune system attacking the body’s own cells / type 1 diabetes
transplanted bone marrow cells attacking the recipient’s cells / graft versus host disease
destruction of plasma cells by HIV / AIDS
immune system attacking a foreign tissue / transplant rejection

feedback.p: Incorrect. Hay fever is an example of allergy, where the immune system mounts an exaggerated response to an antigen.
Incorrect. Type 1 diabetes is an example of autoimmune disorder.
Incorrect. GVHD is a complication of bone marrow transplant.
Correct. It is T helper (CD4+) cells that are infected by HIV, leading to AIDS.
Incorrect. Transplant rejection is due to the immune system recognizing and attacking a non-self tissue.
